alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 4:51PM MST until August 10 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 800 PM MST /900 PM MDT/. * At 449 PM MST /549 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across a broad area just east of Desert View at the Grand Canyon. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blue Water Base Camp, LCR Confluence Overlook, Gap, Grand Canyon National Park and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... Blue Water Base Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 near mile marker 494. State Route 64 between mile markers 269 and 282. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Little Colorado River, Tatahoysa Wash, Colorado River, Sheep Wash, Lee Canyon, Dry Wash, Hamblin Wash, Tappan Wash, Red Horse Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Deer Tank Wash, Sixtymile Creek, Bekihatso Wash and Comanche Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
